item.title: Serverless Framework: Contact form with TypeScript on AWS
item.description: Create a Backend for a Static Frontend We recently launched the Crawlity website which, like jamestharpe.com, uses Hugo to generate a static site. There’s no database or template engine running on the server - just static files. Unlike jamestharpe.com, crawlity.com needs a back-end to accept contact form submissions. So how does one create a dynamic back-end for a static, “serverless” front-end? Short answer: With the Serverless Framework! Serverless Framework, or simply “Serverless”, is a provider-agnostic framework for defining the functions and events that make up your application.

item.title: Setting up my Hugo Website
item.description: Moving my Website to Hugo I’ve decided to move my website off of WordPress and on to a static site generator. After building sites for several clients using Jekyll, I thought it would be nice to try something new. Since my website has been very neglected, most of the content is outdated so I’m not going to bother moving much of it over. If I were, I might try the wordpress-to-hugo-exporter exporter.
